title: Andersonville National Historic Site: Getting Around
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Directions & Transportation     Getting Around              Getting Around         Detail of park map showing the three access gates on Highway 49. NPS/Andersonville NHS  Three gates along Highway 49 provide access to the main part of the park: The Main Entrance Gate is the northern most gate, and is the primary way visitors should enter the park. The entrance gate provides direct access to the National Prisoner of War Museum. The Cemetery Gate is the middle gate and is used for funerals only. The historic Exit Gate is directly across from the town of Andersonville and is used as the primary means of exit by all visitors.
